heaviest_rainfall.status: The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 04 January 2025, with precipitation totalling 36.8mm.  The rain fell at 4.6mm per hour at times over the course of the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

longest_rain.status: Rain fell for 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 creating a new record that still lasts.  The storm produced a total of 36.8mm with a maximum intensity of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: Since records began on 11 April 2025, the highest lightning strike count in one day is 23 on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: An active storm has been detected in the vicinity.  The last storm experienced was on 03 October 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is currently no heatwaves.  This year there have been 6 heatwavess, usually there are 1.9 heatwavess per year.

tropical.status: The most recent tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (183°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (232.0°) by approximately 49.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: To date, the maximum wind speed recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 8%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in light levels (up 7757 lux) and cloud levels (up 592 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 7996 lux) and cloud levels (up 597 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 591.6m lower than yesterday, 355.0m lower than the past week, 597.1m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 901m minimum and 2830m maximum, with an average of 1035.0m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1390.0m and 1632.1m.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; moderate and mild. Also, air will feel comfortable and balanced and calm and still conditions are expected. Chance of light rain, clouds will occasionally block sunlight, and low sunlight due to cloudy or overcast skies. Little change in the weather.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (92%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
